summary: Anne B. Misita was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents detail her inclusion in the committee's payroll, indicating her role as a staff member during that period. The documents list her name alongside other employees, their salaries, and pay periods.
significance: Anne B. Misita's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
